job description:
Overview
Are you looking to join a talented engineering team to tackle Akamai’s next generation Media products? Are you a self-driven individual that can help Akamai develop technology used by many of the world’s largest media companies for large-scale distribution of video, music, and software? Do you have a passion for networking and being part of a team of like-minded individuals? If so, this position is for you!

As a Software Engineer II you will:
  • Understanding Akamai’s network protocols, applications and how system operates. Optimizing and enhancing Akamai’s network platform performance.
  • Aware of current technologies, designing and developing highly scalable and secure software from conception through deployment.
  • Working with a team of experienced engineers on a variety of client and server-side software projects.
  • Analyzing performance and stability issues on large-scale networks with Big Data skills.
About the Team
You will be part of Akamai's Protocol Optimization engineering organization within the Media Division. The Media Division is responsible for the development of products related to the large-scale distribution of video, music, and software that are deployed by many of the largest media companies. This team supports customers with their over-the-top (OTT) video, live events, and streaming video optimization requirements through the operation of a global, highly-scalable platform for content ingestion and transformation, storage, and high-quality media delivery.
Required Education and Experience
  • 2 years of relevant experience and a Bachelors degree or
  • Masters degree or PhD
Basic Qualifications
  • 2+ years of work experience in engineering or related field.
  • 2+ years of work experience with network configuration and software development in a Linux environment.
  • 2+ years of work experience with at least one the following languages: C/C++, Bash, SQL, Perl, or Python.
  • 2+ years of experience with software control systems such as GIT, Perforce or SVN.
Desired Qualifications
  • Master's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication.
  • Experience with SQL and/or Big Data analysis (Hadoop, Hive, etc). A statistical background is a plus.
  • Familiarity with computer networks.
  • C and Linux kernel programming experience.
  • Self-motivated, communicates well, and learns quickly.
